basics.name: Larry Dyck
basics.label: Software Developer, IT Support
basics.summary: I develop applications for Apple platforms, including iOS, iPadOS, macOS, tvOS, and watchOS.

highlights: Provide legal document services to individuals and law firms

Work with individuals involved in various legal proceedings (plaintiffs in small claims court, lawsuits, divorce etc.), and lawyers working on their behalf that require documents to be verifiably served upon defendants

work.summary: Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues for staff and students
highlights: Assisted students with the use of computer-based hardware and software, set up and configure Mac and PC workstations (including printers and other peripherals) and software applications, and integrated them into the school's environment
Re-imaged Windows workstations using Windows Deployment Services and Microsoft Deployment Toolkit
Managed school wireless network, troubleshooting access point problems, signal strength and throughput
Identified and maintained accurate inventory of computer equipment and software licenses

Submitted daily and/or weekly administrative paperwork including HEAT tickets (call-tracking), status reports, logs, and any other required documentation as specified by the Principal and Technology Support management

work.summary: Managed information systems for small and medium sized companies
highlights: Installed and maintained desktop computers and laptops (both MacOS and Windows), and servers (running Microsoft Small Business Server 2003)
Installed network equipment, email services, and helped advise on project and capital requirements
Performed data backups, monitored security issues, and performed regular maintenance on business technology
Supervision of students at David D. Oughton Elementary School
Maintained school computer hardware and peripherals
Re-imaged computers with Windows 95/98 operating systems
